metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20320 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in s390 eBPF JIT in bpf_jit_insn inarch/s390/net/bpf_jit_comp.c in the Linux kernel. In this flaw, a localattacker with special user privilege can circumvent the verifier and maylead to a confidentiality problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-158.166
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-158.166
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-158.166
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-158.166
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-158.166
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-86.97~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-86.97~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-158.166').
